intro: Amblogyna torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's amblogyna, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Amblogyna torreyi is often found in desert regions, where it adapts to harsh, dry conditions.
